title: (x) Ceramic Tile Center - Hubris (Hollandse), News Gothic {Mike F, Yves}
content:
I have been asked to come up with the fonts on the attached jpeg. I probably can find something similar on the sans, but it’s the serif font I am most desparate for.

It has details of many serif fonts, but nothing that I have come across matches this. I have tried “whatthefont” - nothing.

Is this available in a digital format? Can anyone ID either font?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [File](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604042224/http:/typophile.com/files/drupal_17) | 16.25 KB |
author: evan

comments.content:
Holland (serif. digital ? I don’t think that you’re going to find it. Maybe I’m wrong….)

- - - - - - - - - - - -  
Adjective5™ | Adj5™

David - I think you are talking about the same typeface that I know by the name of Hollandse. Agfa/MT offers [two Compugraphic weights](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604042224/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=242889), but the only version that heavy, I believe, was [Fontbank’s Hubris](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604042224/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/hubris.htm) - which was heavier, even, than the heaviest weight of Hollandse - Bold.

Mike: you’re right. This is the same typeface. I saw that “Hollandse”, but I didn’t think… So… I’m wrong, Evan.

(BTW, if you have “Homage to the Alphabet” pp. 213-4 — you can see Holland)

- - - - - - - - - - - -  
Adjective5™ | Adj5™
The sans is a slightly extended News Gothic Bold if I’m not mistaken.
excellent, I knew you guys would come through.

I just hope that you’re going to use the typeface by Agfa/MT.

- - - - - - - - - - - -  
Adjective5™ | Adj5™
